A man was arrested from Haldwani in Nainital district on Thursday for pulling the reins of a police horse and precipitating its fall during a protest march by the BJP in Dehradun on March 14.

Identified as Pramod Bora, the man was arrested from the Mukhani area of Haldwani on a requisition by Dehradun police, said Nainital SSP Sweety Agarwal.

The man was arrested for forcefully pulling the bridle of the horse and causing its fall, which left it injured, said Dehradun SSP Sadanand Daate.

The horse fell with its entire weight on its hind quarters under the combined impact of BJP’s Mussoorie MLA Ganesh Joshi’s alleged frontal attack on it with a lathi, and Bora pulling up its reins from one side, he explained.

Asked about the horse’s condition, which was operated upon by a team of vets, the SSP said it was still in pain.

“Army doctors are attending to the horse. We are doing everything we can to help it recover,” Mr. Daate said.

Chief Minister Harish Rawat also expressed concern over the condition of the horse. An FIR was lodged at the Nehru Colony police station against the BJP MLA and his associates. — PTI
title: Injury to police horse: man arrested for pulling bridle
